name: quotably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is quotable (= suitable for being repeated by someone else): The play is so quotably funny it would be hard to narrow down my favourite lines to just ten. His annual press conference generally produced some quotably controversial comments to be discussed afterwards.
More examplesFewer examplesHe could be quotably witty, but you had to see his routines live to feel the full impact.They have not, so far, quotably complained about her campaign. He is utterly charming, though less quotably articulate than his wife.
